[h1]SUMMARY[/h1]
Condition Zero Deleted Scenes is the Call of Duty campaign that you never asked for for Counter-Strike.  It provides a multitude of different situations, environments, and enemies for you to fight in decently scripted scenarios.  The campaign starts off kind of slow and generic in the middle east with Taliban fighters, but quickly ramps things up with more interesting scenarios in South America, city-streets, siberia, and Japan, among others.

It features 18 missions, basic AI, some entertaining action and set-pieces, and has an overall very b-movie appeal.

[h1]OVERALL SCORE[/h1]
Moderate recommend

[h1]REPLAY VALUE[/h1]
Low

Dobra gra z fabułą do Counter-Strike: Condition Zero Deleted Scenes. Na początek mamy trening specjalny agentów (wybieramy poziom trudności) i przechodzimy sobie. Sam trening jest ciekawy rozbudowany oraz inne techniki typu: spawacz (do kłódek), krótkofalówki i kamerka. Jak skończymy trening to mamy pierwszą misje w rejonach Afganistanu (przypuszczam). Ratujemy agenta i staramy go odesłać do drugiego oddziału. Jak jest koniec misji to dostajemy "menu" - mapę świata i wybieramy dalsze misje. Jak dla mnie fabuła jest taka dobra. Nie jest jakoś trudna czy łatwa. Czasem denerwowało mnie jak wchodziłem do pomieszczenia to wybuchało beczki i traciłem dużo zdrowia, a potem ciężko przejść z małym HP. Popatrzmy z drugiej strony to Conter-Strike chciało dobrze zrobić na wrażeniu gracza. Polecam pograć sobie tak dla siebie.

[h1] DISCLAIMER: This is a first impressions review, and NOT a full review [/h1]

Counter-Strike: Condition Zero Deleted Scenes is a game developed and published by Valve, and is the sequel to the classic FPS shooter. This version contains deleted scenes that were cut from the original game; Counter-Strike: Condition Zero, hence the title

The game offers some nice graphics, although some ugly glitches here and there, it is pleasant all the same

Counter-Strike: Condition Zero Deleted Scenes overall, however, is a fun game to play, and it does get boring if being played for a long time, but is a very good action game and to play in short bursts

[h1] RECOMMENDED :) [/h1]

[b] REVIEW SOURCES: [/b]
[list]
[*] None

[h1] Counter-Strike: Condition Zero Deleted Scenes [/h1]

[b] A Very Sub-par, Single-player Focused Counter-Strike [/b]

[b] Counter Strike: Condition Zero [/b] sounded somewhat appealing to me on paper - a single-player focused story that could weave a tale within the CS universe. What I encountered instead was a boring, repetitive story mode with predictable mission structure and brainless enemy AI.

The campaign, from what I played, is very disappointing. There doesn't seem to be any coherent plot, so you're just running around doing single-player missions for no reason at all. The diversity of tactics that fuel CS gameplay is so watered down that it frankly doesn't even exist. It plays like a poor version of an original "Call of Duty" title, but at least in those games you have some sort of consistent mission and theme. Here, its essentially a mission pack that proves itself to be fairly basic, boring, and asinine.

There is very little character design, and the levels are appear muddy and washed out. There are cliche hostage rescue missions, escort mission, and "sneak in unnoticed and take everyone out" type missions. The game is flavorless - it functions, but there is no soul behind it.

The audio is at least pretty good, even despite the other technical limitations. With more polish and work put into this title, it really could have served as a stand-out, smash-hit for Ritual, Turtle Rock, and Valve, but alas it was squandered and remains as a very forgettable CS experience. In the end, I would [b] Not Recommend [/b] playing [b] Counter-Strike: Condition Zero [/b] unless you are a very big CS fan and are desperate for some old-school content.

[h2] Final Verdict: 4/10 (Below Average) [/h2]

If you enjoyed this review, feel free to check out my curator page for my thoughts on a variety of other games!

https://store.steampowered.com/curator/37542043-ADHD-Reviews/

This is CS 1.6 but in campaign format. The missions are unrelated to each other, but it's still a nice single player campaign with 6 bonus maps to play in which you can enjoy a little bit of the classic counter strike but with the thrill of the unknown.
All missions play well and are unique in their own way, which is a strong plus. You will also see some familiar maps into the mix, another fun plus.
Deleted Scenes is the best of the two Counter-Strike Condition Zero games, and something I truly recommend playing if you own it or you really like CS in general.
